meanings.definition: A wheel or lever for steering a ship or boat.
meanings.sent1: The captain turned the helm to steer the ship towards the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The sailor gripped the helm tightly to navigate through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull landed on the helm, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean of life, we must each find our own helm to guide us.
meanings.sent5: The creaking sound of the helm turning echoed across the silent sea.

meanings.definition: The position of control or leadership.
meanings.sent1: She took the helm of the company after the retirement of the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The teacher passed the helm of the class to the student council president.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel claimed the helm of the tree, declaring itself king of the forest.
meanings.sent4: With determination and courage, she seized the helm of her destiny.
meanings.sent5: The helm of responsibility weighed heavy on his shoulders as he made crucial decisions.
